comments:
Although bug 113537 should be fixed, I opened this bug to investigate what seems to be a potential performance issue.

I noticed from the stack trace that the inoccent act of setting a DOM attribute value (via the EMF2DOMAdapterImpl) appears to cause a grammar model to be loaded.  It seems to me that many clients of the DOM model will not make and use of grammar information and we should try to be clever about when to trigger the creation of grammar models.  I'm not sure how much work is involved to here but I think it's worth looking into.

Craig, agreed it needs investigating, but don't forget, we do sometimes make use of a grammar while parsing a DOM (e.g. to determine if a tag is ommissable).

traces.message: White spaces are required between publicId and systemId.
